ENTRY       EC 2.6.1.41                 Enzyme
NAME        D-methionine---pyruvate transaminase;
            D-methionine transaminase;
            D-methionine aminotransferase
CLASS       Transferases;
            Transferring nitrogenous groups;
            Transaminases
SYSNAME     D-methionine:pyruvate aminotransferase
REACTION    D-methionine + pyruvate = 4-(methylsulfanyl)-2-oxobutanoate + L-alanine [RN:R03001]
ALL_REAC    R03001
SUBSTRATE   D-methionine [CPD:C00855];
            pyruvate [CPD:C00022]
PRODUCT     4-(methylsulfanyl)-2-oxobutanoate [CPD:C01180];
            L-alanine [CPD:C00041]
COMMENT     Oxaloacetate can replace pyruvate.
HISTORY     EC 2.6.1.41 created 1972, modified 1982
REFERENCE   1  [PMID:5357015]
  AUTHORS   Mapson LW, March JF, Wardale DA.
  TITLE     Biosynthesis of ethylene. 4-methylmercapto-2-oxobutyric acid: an intermediate in the formation from methionine.
  JOURNAL   Biochem J 115:653-61 (1969)
PATHWAY     ec00473  D-Alanine metabolism
DBLINKS     ExplorEnz - The Enzyme Database: 2.6.1.41
            IUBMB Enzyme Nomenclature: 2.6.1.41
            ExPASy - ENZYME nomenclature database: 2.6.1.41
            BRENDA, the Enzyme Database: 2.6.1.41
            CAS: 37277-93-3
///
